MARKETING CLOUD GROWTH
Install and Deploy Data Streams for Marketing Cloud Growth

Several data kits are required to support Marketing Cloud Growth. For most data kits, you install the data kit package and then a Data Cloud admin can create and deploy its related data streams.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with Marketing Cloud Growth Edition


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To install data kits and packages:	

View Setup and Configuration

OR

Salesforce Admin profile

OR

Marketing Cloud Admin permission set


To deploy data streams:	

Marketing Cloud Admin permission set

OR

Marketing Cloud Manager permission set


To add Digital Experiences integrations:	Content Admin role
SEE ALSO
Install a Package
Trailhead: Ingestion and Modeling in Data Cloud
Install the Data Kits

Data kits and packages contain the objects, fields, and data connections that make Marketing Cloud Growth work. To begin the data configuration process, install the data kits and packages listed in the Basic Settings section of Marketing Cloud Growth Setup.

Install the Marketing data kits.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Basic. Under Marketing Setup, click Basic Settings
Click Marketing Data.
In the Install Marketing Data Kits section, next to the first data kit in the list, click Install.
On the install page, select Install for All Users, and then click Install.
Repeat these steps to install the other data kits.
Install the Sales data kit.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter CRM. Under Data Cloud Configuration, click Salesforce CRM.
Next to Sales Cloud, click , and select Install.
Install the data kit for all users.
The SMS Channel Integration data kit is required only for orgs with the SMS add-on.

Next, deploy the data streams for each data kit.

Deploy the Required Data Streams

Installing the data kits added the objects and fields that store marketing data. To make the data that you capture available to your marketing tools and processes, set up data streams in Data Cloud. The data streams are already defined in the package. You only need to deploy them.

Initiating data streams counts toward Data Cloud usage.

From the App Launcher, find and select Data Cloud.
Deploy the data streams. Repeat this step for these CRM data bundles: Sales, Flows, MarketingSetup_General, and SMSAddOn-General.
On the Data Streams tab, click New.
Select Salesforce CRM.
Select the Salesforce org that you’re working with, and click Data Bundles.
Make sure that the default data space is selected.
The data stream name and other field values are predefined by the package and can’t be changed.
Review the configuration, and then click Deploy.
Deploy the remaining data streams. Repeat these steps for each data stream in the MessagingEventsEmailEngagement, MessagingEventsSMS, Salesforce Data Cloud - Flow Integration, and UnifiedMessagingConsent data kits.
On the Data Streams tab, click New.
Select Installed Data Kits and Packages.
Select the default data space.
On the Installed Packages tab, select one of the packages that you installed.
Select a data stream from the list.
Some data kits include more than one data stream. Select and deploy each data stream individually.
Review the fields that you’re adding, and click Deploy.
The data stream name and other field values are predefined by the package and can’t be changed.

As you deploy data streams, they’re removed from the package list. When every Marketing Cloud Growth package shows an empty list, you’re done with this step.

title: Setting Up Data Streams for Marketing Cloud Growth
